Nov. 2010) released a budget plan which State Treasurer Bill Lockyer calls realistic and provocative.( David Paul Morris/Getty Images) LOS ANGELES-After three weeks in office and days filled with meetings, the result is a proposal that is realistic and provocative. The plan acknowledges that a balanced remedy of spending reductions and revenues is the best cure, in a statement from State Treasurer Bill Lockyer . The California legislature's logjams during attempts to develop effective responses to the growing deficit had become a perennial problem since the worldwide economic meltdown began. Mr David Cameron told the BBC that he believed Mr Andy Coulson had already made amends for ''bad things'' that happened during his editorship, and insisted that the communications chief deserved a second chance. I always think that the danger at the moment is that he is effectively being punished twice for the same offence, he said. ''I gave him a second chance. I think that sometimes in life it is right to give someone a second chance.'' Mr David Cameron insisted that Mr Andy Coulson was doing his job

fundraisers and other political insiders surveyed by the nonpartisan National Journal, Mitch Daniels recently was chosen as the second-most-likely to get the GOP nomination, after Mitt Romney . Mike Pence didn't make the top 10. Mike Pence displays the kind of optimism, moral values and gutsy leadership we need in a president-- and a presidential nominee, says the draft-Pence website, theconservativechampion.org. to be CEO, Eric Schmidt said during the call. ''It's time for him to have a shot at running this.'' Page hailed Eric Schmidt as a ''tremendous leader'' whose contributions exceeded all expectations. There is really no one else in the universe that could have accomplished what Eric Schmidt has done, Page said. Although he tried to debunk the idea in Thursday's interview, Eric Schmidt may have been growing weary of all the attention and prosaic duties that come with running one of world's most scrutinized companies.

initiative as a natural consequence of Egypt's long-standing policy of seeking the restitution of all archaeological and historical artefacts that have been taken illicitly out of the country, especially those items that are considered unique. The painted bust of Nefertiti is universally recognised as a unique and irreplaceable artefact, Zahi Hawass says.
